articles.title: Green card veteran facing deportation moved to new detention facility as family lashes out
articles.description: A U.S. Army veteran and green card holder who is in the midst of deportation proceedings was moved to a detention in facility in Kankakee on Tuesday, federal officials said. The move comes as his family and advocates continued to lash out at federal officials…

articles.title: Wisconsin program helps people overcome heroin addiction
articles.description: KENOSHA, Wis. (AP) — In the 12 years since he became a heroin addict, Labiano Valdez has tried to quit again and again. He tried inpatient treatment. He tried supported detox. He tried the supportive prescription drug treatments methadone and Suboxone. “I tri…

articles.title: Army veteran on a hunger strike who faces deportation no longer in solitary confinement

articles.title: Veteran facing deportation moved into solitary confinement amid ongoing hunger strike
articles.description: Miguel Perez Jr., 39, served two tours in Afghanistan but was later convicted of felony drug charges and has been ordered deported to his native Mexico.

articles.author: Manya Brachear Pashman and Gregory Pratt
articles.title: Veteran facing deportation moved into solitary confinement amid ongoing hunger strike

articles.title: Green card veteran facing deportation placed on suicide watch, advocates say
articles.description: A U.S. Army veteran and green card holder with a felony drug conviction has been denied an opportunity to see his doctor and placed on suicide watch as he enters his fourth week of a hunger strike to protest his likely deportation, advocates said. Miguel Pere…

articles.title: Empowered by #MeToo, woman files lawsuit after sexual assault in Kenosha County jail
articles.description: Katie Irving was a recovering addict when a jail guard assaulted her. She brought him to justice.
